<h1 align="center">
  Dev Projects Gatsby Starter
</h1>

Kick off your project with this default boilerplate. This starter contains all the default configurations and setup used on Dev Projects

## üöÄ Quick start

1.  **Create a Gatsby site.**

    Use the Gatsby CLI to create a new site, specifying the default starter.

    ```shell
    # create a new Gatsby site using the default starter
    gatsby new my-app https://github.com/mikedane/gatsby-starter-dev-projects
    ```

1.  **Start developing.**

    Navigate into your new site‚Äôs directory and start it up.

    ```shell
    cd my-app/
    gatsby develop
    ```

1.  **Open the source code and start editing!**

    Your site is now running at `http://localhost:8000`!

    _Note: You'll also see a second link: _`http://localhost:8000/___graphql`_. This is a tool you can use to experiment with querying your data. Learn more about using this tool in the [Gatsby tutorial](https://www.gatsbyjs.org/tutorial/part-five/#introducing-graphiql)._

    Open the `my-app` directory in your code editor of choice and edit `src/pages/index.js`. Save your changes and the browser will update in real time!

## üßê What's inside?

A quick look at the features included with this startup:

- [x] Typescript
- [x] Eslint, Prettier (w/ VS Code support)
- [x] Jest + React Testing Library, Cypress
- [x] Storybook
- [x] Tailwind CSS, Emotion
- [x] Github Actions CI file
- [x] State management w/ Context API
- [x] Data from files
